title: Polladhavan
descriptions:
Polladhavan is a 2007 Indian Tamil-language action thriller film directed by National Award-winning director Venkat Prabhu. The movie stars Dhanush in the lead role, marking his debut as a director with this film, alongside him are Bharathi, Saranya Mohan, and Sameer Dattani.

The story revolves around a young man named Polladhavan, also known as Karikalan (Dhanush), a physically strong and impetuous individual, who is full of anger and has a short fuse. Karikalan lives in a slum and works as a delivery boy for a local cable TV operator. He is close to his friend and neighbor, Chandran (Sameer Dattani), and constantly looks out for him.

One day, Karikalan meets a college student named Tamizh (Bharathi), and starts to develop feelings for her. Tamizh, however, belongs to a higher social class, and their social differences create tension in their relationship. Karikalan's anger issues continue to get him into trouble, and he gets into a fight with a local gangster, who is also Tamizh's uncle.

As the story unfolds, Karikalan and Tamizh's relationship deepens, but their social differences create obstacles in their love. Meanwhile, Chandran gets involved with a goon, who is also a key player in the local gangster's operations. Karikalan's anger issues escalate, leading to a series of violent confrontations.

The film takes a dramatic turn when Karikalan discovers that Tamizh's uncle is planning to marry her off to a man she doesn't love. Karikalan decides to take matters into his own hands and kidnaps Tamizh, hoping to protect her from an arranged marriage. However, his actions lead to chaos and puts Tamizh in greater danger.

The film's climax features an action-packed sequence where Karikalan confronts the local gangster and his goons, leading to a violent showdown. In the end, Karikalan emerges victorious, but not without scars. The film ends on a hopeful note, with Karikalan and Tamizh's love for each other stronger than ever.

Polladhavan is a gripping and intense film that explores themes of love, anger, and social class. The film features stunning performances from Dhanush and Bharathi, and is notable for its direction, which blends action, drama, and romance seamlessly. The film received positive reviews from critics and audiences alike, and is considered a classic of Tamil cinema.
